DOC.HEAD: Man Driving Stolen Truck Kills Christmas Tree Shoppers
Eds: Brake is cq in 2nd graf
DOC.TEXT: A man driving a stolen pickup truck slammed into a farmer's market and killed two people who were shopping for a Christmas tree, authorities said. Brake Wade, 15, of Collinsville was pronounced dead of internal injuries at Anderson Hospital in Maryville shortly after the accident Sunday evening, said Madison County Coroner Dallas Burke. Roland Cox, 37, of Pontoon Beach died in surgery several hours later, Burke said. The 30-year-old driver, who was not injured, was being held in the Collinsville City Jail pending felony charges of reckless homicide and possession of a stolen vehicle, said David Niebur, the city's police chief. Collinsville is in southwest Illinois. The driver's name was not immediately released. Police were investigating whether alcohol was a factor in the accident. Niebur said the pickup truck had been stolen earlier in the day from nearby Belleville.
